Reviews.Title: “Best Western - average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Joanne C
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel as the last place to stay on our trip through California. The location was ideal, and the price reasonable. The hotel itself was ok, room was clean and had all we required for the little time you need to spend in your hotel when visiting L.A. I agree with the other reviewers about the front desk staff, they were surly, unhelpful and preferred to speak in Spanish to their colleagues rather than speak to customers waiting at the desk. This comes as a big shock after holidaying for 2 weeks in California where customer service is usually exceptional and always delivered with a smile. The young man who works in the hotel 'Spice cafe' is a different matter, he was polite, cheerful and provided excellent services, his colleagues should take a leaf out of his book!! Having said all this, I wouldn't let it put you off from staying here, just don't expect a warm welcome from the front desk staff!!

Reviews.Title: “Bad Customer service”
Reviews.Author: Sergio G
Reviews.Content: The Customer service was terrible. We were initially given a rate, and then when we arrived we were given a higher rate and a room with one bad instead of two that we had requested. We were also unaware that the room rate did not include breakfast and parkng, which is entirely separate. The front desk staff was also not very friendly or helpful, they seemed more concerned with taking our money and then sending us on our way out, after taking our money. The hotel carpets and overal cleanliness of the rooms were average at best. If there is one positive experiece was that the major Hollywood attractions are within walking distance from the hotel location.

Reviews.Title: “good location but poor service for the price”
Reviews.Author: Matt D
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel due to the closeness to the hollywood blvd and the price was cheaper than the other hotels in the same area but still approx 150 per night . The room smelled moldy and carpet was really dirty,breakfast was pretty expensive at their restaurant so we skipped and went down to McDonalds instead.Tv channels do not have cable tv.Ooutdoors Swimming pool was not heated,parking was very hard to find even though they charged 10 per night,open walkways led to no privacy in room and too much noise all thrught the night from traffic and people walking by. Front desk staff are just about ok,not really interested in thier jobs and do not expect quality customer service especially from the girl in the morning. Would not stay here again but try the 3 other hotels around same price range in the vicinity.

Reviews.Title: “Spice Cafe at Best Western Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: manika24
Reviews.Content: I didn't stay at the hotel, just came in to their Spice Cafe. It is a small, cozy cafe with pleasant ambiance, and most importantly VERY pleasant staff. I had a Groupon and they welcomed it w/o any hesitation and a smile. Many times, when coupons are used - staff gives you a look, not here. Ordered 2 sandwiches - chicken salad and tuna melt - both were fine. Prices are around $7.50 for sandwiches. Other reviewers recommended their French Toast, but I haven't tried it.

Reviews.Title: “Went the Extra Mile”
Reviews.Author: DJandSJ
Reviews.Content: There were 7 in our family traveling in our coach. We took 2 rooms for the night. The rooms were dated but clean and roomy. The hotel clerk and their janitor went the extra mile in making a space available for us to park our RV. The kids enjoyed both the pool and hot tub. Breakfast (family run business) next door was very good. We enjoyed our walk to the Star Walk and shops (10 minute walk from the hotel).

Reviews.Title: “Really good location”
Reviews.Author: ebors
Reviews.Content: We wanted to be close to the action for Oscar's night, and we were! It was just a few minutes walk to the Kodak Theatre and to lots of restaurants and bars. I was slightly disappointed by the initial look of the hotel rooms - it looked rather like a seedy motel. However, the rooms were adequate for our needs, if slightly old and basic. The staff were very good and helpful and the hotel clean and well run.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: Sparky0121
Reviews.Content: This motel is in an excellent location. 5 min walk to the Kodak theatre and walk of fame. It is a $15 taxi ride to Universal Studios. You can catch a Hop on Hop off bus at the walk of fame and do all of your site seeing from this location. The rooms are well equipped (no mini bar, but there is a liquor store 2min walk away). The rooms are of a good size, clean and well decorated. The onside restaurant is very well priced and the food is of a good standard. The staff are helpful, we went to Disneyland for the day and reception booked a private transfer for $100 in each direction for us. Salvador was our driver and the vehicle would have fitted 7 people comfortably. And we were picked up on time. Overall, great motel, great location. I would recommend this place to family, friends and would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Meh!”
Reviews.Author: Amika A
Reviews.Content: Chose this place due to proximity to Hollywood attractions and cheaper rates....you get what you pay for I guess ;( I had 2 major problems:First was the appaling customer service and attitude from the girl who says she is hotel manager ZULY Vadallares .The other staff were not great either but at elast didnt have the poor attitude and helped us book tours and other local stuff. Second is the condition of the room.Dirty carpets,super loud plumbing and AC which kept us up every night if not the crazy drunks and cars due to open corridor so every room overlooks the parking lot! Next time will surely pay a bit more and be treated better at the countless other options on the same stretch...

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but a few things to keep in mind”
Reviews.Author: chicago90Phoenix
Reviews.Content: Yes, great location to the attractions. It would be classified as a "motel" with outside walk ways. The room was clean, but dated. Parking is rather tight and extremely limited. If you are booking this room through a non-Best Western search engine, you may want to see how the parking is categorized - is it free or is there a charge? I had this debate at the front desk and I showed my printouts. Not the nicest conversation to have when you are checking in. If I had to say a negative is trying to pull in/out of the property with a car during rush hour. The hotel is close to 101 and you must have a ton of patience and the skill to pull out/in timely when your opportunity arises.

Reviews.Title: “'SPICEY'”
Reviews.Author: LIZ B
Reviews.Content: Location gets 5 stars.Very close to our friend we were visiting.Loved Brandon&Caesar in Spice Cafe.Great food,service and lots of fun.Least liked the risky&unsafe&critical traffic in front of BW driveway.

Reviews.Title: “Small but clean and convenient to Hollywood Blvd”
Reviews.Author: TheKs42
Reviews.Content: Our room was pretty "compact" but more than adequate for mostly sleeping. We were there three nights and, since it was appreciably less expensive than other nearby places, would stay again. There are some other hotels around the immediate area that we are VERY happy we didn't choose.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: eccentriq
Reviews.Content: With reference to previous reviews, I too would also agree that the Hollywood Plaza Inn is more so a Motel for travelers looking for the basic necessities. The staff were nice, however did not let us check-in early (14:00Hrs) - probably our fault than theirs. The location of the Inn is 5-10mins to the Hollywood Blvd and it's various attractions/restaurants etc. Pros: Location Clean rooms Powerful shower head Bar fridge Cable TV $50 Flat rate private car service to LAX (through reception) Uncertain: Staff helpful to a certain degree Cons: Heater fairly loud at night

Reviews.Title: “Great location but had a few glitches”
Reviews.Author: CBNtraveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a great location with just a 5-10 minute walk to the Kodak and Chinese Theaters, the Walk of Fame, and numerous restaurants, shopping, theaters, etc. The hotel is more like a motel; it's glass enclosed in the front but the entire hotel is open. It has a small cafe downstairs, there are reasonably priced vending machines throughout, and free garage parking on the main level. We made a hotel reservation for two double rooms as we were two groups of adults traveling with children. We arrived at the hotel at midnight, exhausted, checked in and when we arrived at our room; they had booked us in two king rooms. When we returned downstairs, we were told that there were no double rooms available for the first night. Their first option was to give us two king rooms down the hall from one another for one night and switch us over for the second night. Having children and sharing luggage made it impossible to have two rooms that didn't connect, and we weren't about to spend our only day in LA packing up to switch rooms again. Luckily a few minutes later they had a cancellation and were able to give us a "suite", which was a room with a king bed and a small sofa sleeper. The staff tried hard to try and be accommodating. The rooms are basic, typical hotel decor; however, the hotel was very clean (bathrooms, linens, etc.) and rooms always smelled fresh. Our toilet wasn't working the first evening, and we had to fill the tank with water to get it to flush. We reported the next morning, as we were just too tired that first night, and it was repaired when we returned. The other room with the rest of our party also had a toilet clog in the morning, which was immediately repaired. The front desk staff in the morning was very helpful in providing directions and making arrangements for tours. Overall, the hotel is in a great location, very reasonably priced, basic but clean with a friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great service”
Reviews.Author: Jason D
Reviews.Content: The room was adequate but the service was outstanding! Delicious french toast in cafe. Very near all the tourist sites, hollywood board walk, wax museum, a mall, etc...we could walk but not very far at all!

Reviews.Title: “Motel rather than hotel...”
Reviews.Author: dgafrica
Reviews.Content: Not my best experience but the check in service was good and the staff friendly. The room was small and the bathroom OK. It was not that cheap either but I guess that's because of the location which is nice if you want to visit the sights. The restaurant is more like a little cafe but it has a large selection although it's not what one would associate with a hotel restaurant. The free parking is a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent! Will Visit Again”
Reviews.Author: Prasath S
Reviews.Content: I stayed and enjoyed every day with comfort sleep and good food and good service. Really looked after very well. very friendly staff. Location is very good too. Totally top class.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: CASTLEFOX
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two night's in the summer right in the middle of carmagedon!! No problem, we left the car and walked or got the tube, which was free!! The hotel is in a great location for sightseeing, a short walk to Hollywood Boulevard where there are plenty of bars and restaurants. We also visited Universal Studios, which is one stop away on the tube - excellent. The room was clean and nicely furnished. There is a small cafe downstairs that did a nice breakfast for a resonable price and the staff were friendly and corteous. We did get kept awake by the security gurds chatting outside out room but after a quick call to reception it was resolved.

Reviews.Title: “Will return :)”
Reviews.Author: rayray581
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night on 10/31/11. The check-in process was very quick, and the staff was friendly. One of the biggest perks of this location is the FREE parking. This is a rare find in LA, and very much appreciated. You can't beat the location. In close proximity to a variety of places to see in LA. If you're the walking type....many places to get to by foot. If you feel like venturing further, the subway is a close walk as well. We decided to take the car to West Hollywood for the Halloween Carnival. Aside from the regular "LA" traffic, it was a quick ride. Upon returning later that evening, there were plenty of parking spaces still available. The morning we departed we decided to hike/run Runyon Canyon. The hotel staff was kind enough to give us a late check-out. So after we hiked, we were able to return and shower. We really appreciated their flexibility. The rooms were clean. The usual wear and tear, but nothing gross. We had a room at the farthest end from the street so noise wasn't a problem. Shower worked nicely, and the fridge/microwave were nice to have available. This hotel has pretty much all the things you need when staying in Hollywood. Proximity to attractions (very close to Universal Studios, Hollywood Bowl, Hollywood Blvd), the FREE Parking is a big deal (trust me), and a clean place to stay while exploring LA. I have also stayed at the Days Inn on Sunset Blvd and would prefer this Best Western. Cleaner, and smells much better. Plenty of options to eat at nearby as well. There are also CVS/Fresh and Easy stores nearby so if you want to stock your fridge. I would definitely stay here....and hopefully will be sooner than later. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Slav p
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 2 nights and besides the microwave oven not working the room was clean. The aircon is noisy and blows into the curtains. What this place has going for it is good parking and an absolutely great location..timed 7minutes to the blvd.Also pretty cheap.Staff at the counter were good.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for tourists”
Reviews.Author: Elly
Reviews.Content: This hotel is real close to the Kodak Theater and Hollywood Boulevard - within walking distance. There are good places to eat in the mall that faces Hollywood Blvd. With our rental car, we easily got to CBS studios for The Price is Right and to Sony Studios for Wheel of Fortune. The hotel was quiet and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location in Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: galbers1892
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights in September 2011. The hotel is in an excellent location, with Hollywood Boulevard, and the Kodak and Graumann theatres about 10 minutes walk. Although it is close to those areas, the hotel itself is fairly quiet. The rooms are fairly small, but have all the essentials and are clean. There is also free parking, which is a large bonus if you do happen to be driving and there is also a pool located at the back of the complex. The only downside to this hotel is the fact you have to pay extra for breakfast. I found it far cheaper to pick up something on the go from a nearby shop/bakery. I would recommend this hotel for a first trip to LA. If I were to go again, I think I would choose to stay in Beverley Hills, as for all but the central section of Hollywood Boulevard, in my opinion, the area has seen better days.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: beenthere088
Reviews.Content: Last nights of a 5 week trip to Canada and the US. Nice staff, great little restaurant, well located, very close to Hollywood Bowl and a 5 minute walk to Hollywood Blvde. Agree the aircon unit is VERY loud and is placed so it blows cold air up behind the curtain and not much gets into the room. Still would stay there again and were very happy with our decision to stay in Hollywood and NOT LA Downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Short Stay with Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: mitlovek
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the BW Hollywood Plaza Inn recently whilst visting family living nearby. Had stayed in the same hotel a few years back; have to say that would really recommend to anybody to stay here as the staff service levels have really improved and they went the extra mile to ensure that we were very comfortable. Keep up the good work and will be coming back definelty.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for Hollywood Bowl”
Reviews.Author: bigredjm
Reviews.Content: This Best Western is about a 5 minute walk to the Hollywood Bowl, and very close to Hollywood Blvd. We will stay there again when attending a Hollywood Bowl event. The rooms are clean, beds are OK. The air conditioning unit is rather loud. The staff is pleasant, but may not know the area very well; they didn't know the closest liquor store was right down the street. Parking spots are difficult to get in/out of due to being so close to the building.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome...”
Reviews.Author: LalitaNaran
Reviews.Content: The staff was extremely polite and helpful. The hotel is very relaxing and clean. I would recommend to friends/family that they should stay there. Hotel is just walking distance to Kodak theater, hollywood blvd, and metro station if you are planning to goto Universal Studio. I would not hesitate to stay again on a future vacation... Keep up the good work!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Service- Best Expiriance”
Reviews.Author: Rik S
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff was very friendly and went out of their way to help me.. Manager was great.. He went out of way to help me..Best breakfast , and compare to other hollywood hotels price was very reasonable... clean property....

Reviews.Title: “The worst customer service experience in 15 years of traveling to Hollywood !!!”
Reviews.Author: Salimmer
Reviews.Content: The very fact that this hotel had rooms available when 15 other hotels in the vicinity were sold out should have been an indication as to the experience we were about to have! We usually stay at Roosevelt but due to last min plans we had to make do with staying here for 3 nights as we had no other choice ... The management charged our friend screit card used for reservation as well as ours upon check in,despite dozen calls to management and best western corporate office it took more than a month to get the fraudulent charge reversed!No apology or explanation for the extra charge ,BEWARE of using credit cards here as they will charge it for nonsensical reasons and NOT REFUND. As to the hotel,rooms were small and not worth the price at all....ridiculously tiny parking lot where we witnessed 2 accidents in 3 days.Nobody ever answers front desk calls and every staff member was always on personal cell phone calls eveyr time we passed by,zero customer service of any kind!Negligent management at the hotel was embarrassing for any franchise hotel .Internet and cell phone reception was non existent so you have to walk to next door hotel for making cell phone call or for Internet . In summary we will NEVER try a best western chain again due to a very bad experience here...stay far away from this place.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location. Decent price.”
Reviews.Author: Dan S S
Reviews.Content: Nothing spectacular, but comfortable, clean, ideal location, reasonable price and free parking. No reason to expect any more. Less than 5 mins walk to Hollywood sites and shopping. Not too loud. Also a metro station closeby with a single stop to universal (NB if you get this - which is worth it as it is easy and saves paying for parking - there is a free shuttle to universal to take you up the hill from the metro stop but good luck finding it as the signage is terrible - tip = head to the bottom of the hill near the Sheraton).

Reviews.Title: “good place to visit LA”
Reviews.Author: drfb
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in walking distance from Hollywood Boulevard and a shopping center with plenty of restaurants and bars. The hotel has a free parking space. Breakfast in Spices in a small room is served without delays and of good quality. The room is adequate for a city trip where you need only a sleeping place with the necessary amenities. No luxury but adequate for a 3 nights in LA : don't miss Hollywood - The Getty Villa - The Getty Museum - Lacma and the tar pits nearby - Downtown and The pueblo.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay was comfortable, most likely to book again”
Reviews.Author: Selshans
Reviews.Content: When we stayed there, the woman at the front desk in the morning was not helpful and discourteous. She needs a bit of training on how to treat the hotel guests when they approach her for any enquiry. Hope the management will look into it, The men at the reception were very helpful and courteous. We appreciated their attitude. In general, we enjoyed our stay, daily room-making and so on. - Sam from Australia

Reviews.Title: “I want to give this a 4 but I can't...”
Reviews.Author: Nethercote
Reviews.Content: It has free parking, though it's not guaranteed. Rooms were clean and comfortable but the service from the guy at reception was unacceptable and rude. Totally unhelpful but apparently he got sacked the next day so... Location was good for the Hollywood Walk of Fame but very hard to get around the rest of the city... but that's just LA. My biggest concern here was I had to print out some stuff on the hotel computer. That stuff was sensitive, confidential info so I wanted to make sure no copy was stored on the computer. Lo and behold it took me an hour and half to try and delete my files off the computer as they had been saved into a file on the hard drive which could be accessed by any user but only deleted by an Admin. There were literally hundreds and thousands of other guests files saved there as well. Eventually a woman came to assist me and it turned out that she and her husband had just purchased the hotel and were unaware of the problem as they we just taking possession (hence the sacking of the rude receptionist). I eventually managed to delete my documents and she was already on the phone trying to get a computer security company to come and look at the computer. I kind of made it very clear that the currently settings which saved everything onto the hard drive was a massively unacceptable situation. She offered me a free breakfast for two in the cafe the next morning for my trouble which was nice.. the Belgian Waffles with strawberrys and coffee were very good. Just make sure the computer has been fixed if you use it and is not saving all your downloaded documents. I'm not sure I would stay here again but that probably has more to do with the fact I don't see myself returning to LA more than anything to do with the hotel itself.

Reviews.Title: “Room Rate Not What We Agreed To”
Reviews.Author: Stacey1967
Reviews.Content: I frequent the Hollywood Bowl many times each summer. This Saturday the 405 freeway will be shut down, so I attempted to book a room at the Best Western on Highland to avoid gridlock. Josh at the hotel promised me a room rate of $159 if I booked tonight. I told him I would call back to book. When I called back, one hour later at 8:50pm, on a Wednesday, he said that he could no longer honor our agreement, and that it would be $189. I protested and said that he should keep his word and our agreement. He put me on hold twice, wasted my time, and refused to honor his word. He did come down to $179, but by that time I was very offended. I honor my word. Thank you Josh for wasting my time and pissing me off. I told him I would write several reviews on his hotel, and call back for a supervisor tomorrow, which I will do, because I keep my word...as no supervisor was apparently available tonight.

Reviews.Title: “Good location & free parking!”
Reviews.Author: mightymightydragons
Reviews.Content: The two biggest draw-cards about this hotel is the location to Hollywood Blvd (5-10min walk) and the free parking. The hotel has an older, motel-like feel to it and the rooms are basic and clean. The one thing that irritated me was the air freshener that the housekeeping staff used in the room - it was overbearing and it would make me sneeze endlessly every time I returned back to the hotel of an evening. There is free WiFi on offer but the reliability factor is a bit touch-and-go. We tried to use Skype to call home and the connection was cutting in and out. Much worse during 'peak hours' between 7pm - 11pm when I'm guessing that most hotel guests are using the WiFi. Cell phone coverage in this location was also average to poor (not that this a fault of the hotel). Roaming on either AT&T or T-Mobile networks, I had very little signal and at times, had no signal at all. Overall, this is a reasonably priced property which serves up the basics well.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean , nice place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Awk1
Reviews.Content: The place was well kept and clean House keeping was very professional as well as the staff. "I'll be back."

Reviews.Title: “A QUIET NIGHT”
Reviews.Author: DaveB54
Reviews.Content: This hotel is centrally located, walking distance to the entire downtown Hollywood area, and even though Highland Ave is a busy street, we had the most quiet, comfortable rests that you could possibly have. The rooms are clean and comfortable and my only complaint was that I had to go to the front desk more than once for soap & shampoo, as the maid seemed to skip replacing ours several times in a 7-day stay. I would recommend this Best Western to everyone and their rates are very competitive in an area where many Inns charge extra for vehicle parking, there parking is free.The attatched restaurant , "Spice" always had great breakfasts to start our day

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is Clean! Dated a bit, and much more like a Motel.”
Reviews.Author: Ted329
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at this hotel for 5 nights the end of February because we had come to town for the Oprah after Oscar Party show...Having never been to Hollywood before and not knowing where to stay and not having a huge budget, we chose this hotel...When we arrived the front desk clerk was terrific and helpful. We were surprised that it is clearly more motel style than hotel style. We were a bit skeptical when we got inside the room...but if you can get past how dated this motel is, I will tell you we found it to be really very clean and well kept inside and out. The front desk staff was helpful during our entire, the Hollywood bus tour they suggested was fantastic we took that the second day in town and they picked us up right at the hotel and dropped us back off at the end of the day at the hotel..We ate at the hotel restaurant several times and each time the food was fine and good priced and the staff was just as fantastic. The location to all the sights is within walking distance which was great...It was a little sketchy walking late one night but other than that it is just fine...The parking is tough at night but as someone else said FREE parking in Hollywood is very few and far between...if I were to go back to Hollywood I would stay here again...

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful but decent service on the main desk”
Reviews.Author: the_gamekeeper
Reviews.Content: We booked to stop for3nights as we decided to stop off there after spending a week Palm Springs.I was hopeful that it would be a decent hotel having stopped in Best Westerns all over the world.However the rooms were stuck in a 1960's time warp,and were cramped,dated and a little bit grubby.I also thought the open motel style of the hotel wasn't really ideal in such a dodgy area!We decided after one night to cancel as basically the place was a dump,however the guy called Pedro on the desk was really helpful,booked us into our next hotel and seemed genuinely awaken aback at our complaints.A nice guy,shame about the horrible hotel though!!

Reviews.Title: “No Frills Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ILoveWaffles
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival, having a truck to park in their parking spaces felt a little bit iffy. Their parking spaces are a tad on the smaller side, but we adapted by just parking in one of the designated parking spaces on the side of one bottom floor walls - not in an actual parking stall. Parking was free, albeit, limited. (& made us a bit scared to come back late and not have a spot). Checking in was a breeze, the front desk young male was very pleasant and cheerful. We walked to our room to find that the room door was already propped open & the heater was on full blast with the window open (other rooms around it were the same). They were cleaning the carpets to the rooms, which was a plus, but our carpet was still a bit damp when we arrived. The room was comfortable and had a fridge, a microwave, and a coffee maker. I was happy to see that the light in the bathroom was bright and not dim at first (like some other hotels I've stayed at). The hotel was in close proximity to a lot of things you could do, so that was a plus. Free wireless internet in the room - but our connection was really in and out so it was kind of hard to watch something on the laptop. The cons of this hotel would probably be that it was designed more like a motel, so the hallways are not closed, they are open and you can hear the traffic and everybody who walks by, especially if they just came back from going out all day/night. The air conditioner/heater was particularly loud when it was bringing the temp. back up/down, but quiet when it was in-between those cycles. Also, the TV was a bit weird, it was a flat screen Samsung but it had lines that would run across it while you were watching - it reminded me of those old TVs. I already mentioned the parking spaces, so beware if you have a large car, if you can't get one of the more easily to back out of spots in the back. The parking area could probably maybe fit 20-30 cars at most.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, unintersted staff”
Reviews.Author: m-melb9
Reviews.Content: Travelled with sister, 2 nights stay. On arrival reception staff not very welcoming. Was also not very knowledgable of area or maybe couldn't be bothered to gie advice. Noticed the same attitude by different staff with other guests during our 3 day stay there. Suites were roomy, comforble and clean. There is a small cafe attatched to the motel which provided a nice breakfast. Easy short walk up to Hollywood Blvd. Hop on, hop off bus great to get around and sightsee. Overall the Hollywood area is very run down and somewhat dirty but I guess needs to be seen. Rodeo Drive area obviously much nicer and also quieter than Hollywood. Hard Rock cafe on Hollywood Blvd good place to eat. Can get to University Studios easily by taking subway near Kodak Theatre.

Reviews.Title: “SUPER SHUTTLE DO NOT USE”
Reviews.Author: loycemike
Reviews.Content: We had chosen this hotel for the conveient location, and it really was within 5-10 minute-walking distance of the Hollywood Bowl, and Kodak Theatre! The room was clean and comfortable, and provided comfortable towels. A small outside swimming pool and hot tub was onsite, however we didn't utilize them. (too chilly) A small microwave and room size fridge was a delite to have for our cold drinks. Now, I phoned 3 times to find out about their "nominal fee" shuttle to transport us from LAX to the hotel. The first time, the person at the desk said, in very hard to understand thick accent, that a shuttle was available and to call them. OK???? So the next day I telephoned the front desk, to call them and this desk clerk said to call them at the desk and they would give us the phone number to CALL THE SHUTTLE BUS...... Um ok??? Soooo, the day before I was to fly, I called the third time, as instructed, to get the number of the shuttle, only to be TOLD THAT I am to use the "courtesy phones" by baggage claim, and the shuttle will come. I get my bag, and use the "courtesy" phones.... forwhich NOW I am instructed that they don't set up shuttles. It is ran indepentaly, and the "SuperShuttle", it is outside. Okkkkk????? We find the SuperShuttle, and say to the man in the SuperShuttle Uniform we needed to go to BestWestern, and he asks, "Do you have a reservation?" WTH?!?!?! We eventually were taken to the BESTWESTERN HOLLYWOOD PLAZA INN via SuperShuttle, of a ride that lasted almost 3 hours later, so by 2:30 A.M.S we arrived. ( I had notified the desk several times that I would be a late arrival) The fee for the shuttle was only 16.00, (not bad) but IF THE DESK CLERK HAD TOLD US THAT RESERVATIONS WERE NEEDED and could be done at supershuttle.com it would have been better, OR IF THE WEB SITE HAD DIRECTLY SAID THAT, AND NOT JUST A "NOMINAL" FEE vs. an independant contractor would have been better planning for us! The reason the shuttle took so long?>>> The shuttle takes anyone, not just the BEST WESTERN patrons, ANY/EVERWHERE. They drive while texting and entering data into a mounted computer laptop.

Reviews.Title: “good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: Floridakayaker
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights while visiting friends nearby and felt comfortable and safe at a reasonable price. The attached restaurant was a real bonus providing gourmet meals and terrific lattes. It was somewhat noisy but the rooms where soundproofed pretty well. There was on site parking and a computer for customer use.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: Bluechip78
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my wife while visiting LA. The hotel is nothing spectacular but is clean and comfortable. There was a slight traffic noise in the rooms next to the street but nothing too disturbing. It's a short 5-10 min walk to Hollywood boulevard for those who want to take in the sights.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location!”
Reviews.Author: Thiago_Rio
Reviews.Content: I booked a room at the hotel based on the fact that it was supposed to have a good location, but even then, I was surprised at how good location actually was. A few steps out the door and you get a good look at the Hollywood sign, and in 2 minutes you are at the Walk of Fame, Sunset Boulevard. The Hollywood Highland center is nearby, which is convenient for shopping, and I guess anyone who wants to walk around downtown Hollywood should be more than happy with the hotel, which has good enough rooms and staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: calucatoo
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Best Western was enjoyable. Upon arrival we were put into the wrong room with only 2 double beds instead of a King size bed so we went back to reception and they immediately upgraded us to a suite for the night. The reception staff were friendly and helpful. The location is good about a 5minute walk to Hollywood boulevard. Can be a bit noisy at night due to the traffic but still managed to fall asleep easily. Overall a good experience for the price would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a Hollywood Bowl concert”
Reviews.Author: Nellie019
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three days to see Tom Petty at the Hollyood Bowl and do the Hollywood sightseeing thing. The location was excellent for both. A five minute walk to the bowl which is an amazing venue. Having free car parking at the hotel saved on parking costs and hassles. Also only a short walk to Hollywood Blvd. The rooms are a bit drab but they are clean and comfortable enough. I was a little disturbed however when we first arrived to find our room door open and the maintainance man "spraying for ants" we were told. I probably should have asked management at the time just what the spray was. Apart from this incident I would say this hotel is reasonable value for the area and can also recommend the Spice restaurant for a great breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Location is great, rooms are comfortable, service has room for improvement”
Reviews.Author: Melanie_USA1985
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 3 nights at the beginning of october, did not book in advance and were lucky to get a free room at 2pm in the afternoon. You should not arrive later, you might not find a room available. I recommend to book a room in advance if you stay more than 1 night. positive aspects - directly on Highland Ave, only 5-10 min walk to Hollywood Blvd, very convenient if you like to go to Madame Tussauds, Walk of Fame, Hard Rock Cafe, Hollywood Museum, Chinese Theatre and many souvenir shops - free parking, many parking spots - close to metro station Hollywood/Highland, close to Universal Studios and Hollywood bowl - rooms are clean, big, beds are comfortable - because of noise in the room service personell offered to switch rooms for free (we were offered a room with jacuzzi) - because of the trouble we were offered a private shuttle to the airport for a special price; when the car came it was a black strech limousine - awesome!! negative aspects - DO NOT stay in room 343, the water heater is above it and is extremely loud at night - shuttle to airport is $15 per Person - breakfast is not included in hotel room

Reviews.Title: “Not great value for the money, but OK”
Reviews.Author: tambocha
Reviews.Content: Most Best Westerns at least include breakfast in the room rate, even their less-expensive properties. This one is among the more expensive BWs, and it does not. The place is well located in Hollywood, the room was clean, and there was free parking available, but the TV remote barely worked and was frustratingly difficult to get to do what I wanted. It still surprised me a lot to find that even the usual basic breakfast of toast, muffins and cereal wasn't provided here.

Reviews.Title: “OK for just 1 night.”
Reviews.Author: CA*PastryChef
Reviews.Content: Booked this motel at the last minute & got a decent deal considering the hotel I originally wanted to stay at was well over $200. When we drove up to the motel, my boyfriend & I thought 'OHHHH NO!'. The motel looked a bit sketchy...the exterior looked dirty & dated. Don't let that fool you though. We had a smooth check-in. The clerk & who I believed to be the manager were very nice. I asked the clerk for a quiet room & she gave us a room in the very back of the hotel. In my reservation though, I asked to be away from elevators & ice machines. Well, she put us right next to both =( . It had been a long drive, our stay was for only 1 night so I didn't want to complain. We get in our room & I'm SHOCKED at how clean it is. I did a thorough bed bug search & am happy to report that I didn't find any bugs at all. YAY! Here's the thing though...as we approached our room, the door was wide open. They just steam cleaned the carpet (which is very nice) BUT we couldn't get the carpet to dry. As we left for the evening, we left the heater on. When we got back to our room later that night, it was still very damp & there was condensation on the windows. We walked around with socks on & our socks got wet, not good. Oh! Another note, whatever they used to clean the bathroom floor made the floor extremely slippery. I slipped the first time I walked in & grabbed the counter to not fall. I was cautious about it from then on but still slid in several times like Babe Ruth into home plate! Strangely dangerous! We go to bed & in the middle of the night, we both felt really uncomfortable & sticky because it felt really humid in our room. We didn't sleep well because of this. Fast forward a few hours...it got SO NOISY. You can hear guests & their housekeeping rolling their carts outside & the room actually vibrates. You can hear your immediate neighbor turning water on & off...it was SO loud. I think if our room wasn't so damp & it wasn't so noisy, we would've had a much better stay. The room itself was nice, big & clean. I need more than just a decent looking room though...I need thicker walls & carpeted exterior to cut down on noise. The street noise of Highland didn't even affect us, it was the guests & staff! Not horrible for 1 night but I won't return.

Reviews.Title: “Close, convenient, clean”
Reviews.Author: 2teeth
Reviews.Content: Just stayed one night..went to "Dancing with the Stars" and Universal Studios Tours. Convenient location for both..right in the middle. Cab ride expensive 35.00 from Burbank airport...but walked to Hollywood and Highland mall and saw the Kodak theatre, shopping, Grahmans Chinese. Right own the street from Hollywood Bowl. Clean..nice people..actually quiet location.

Reviews.Title: “A great base to explore LA from”
Reviews.Author: angiebeno
Reviews.Content: Great location as its right down the road from the Hollywood/Highland centre which has all the shops/bars and movie theatres you could need - also very close to Universal Studios (about a 5 minute drive) The room was on the third floor and was quite close to Highland Ave (a very bust street) However we found the room to be quiet and got a very good nights sleep on each of the three nights we stayed. Don't recommend the pool, its tiny and is shoved in the smallest space possible at the back of the car park! The restaurant spice was great for breakfast and the staff were helpful and friendly - was a little concerned about walking aroung the neighbourhood as there are a few homeless people around but we had no problems during our stay. Would recommend and would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but frustrating”
Reviews.Author: Doloads
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a fantastic location, and has much promise, but also some frustrating flaws. The good: Location is fantastic. Close to Hollywood Blvd, Hollywood Bowl, Universal Studios etc. Rooms are very clean. Reasonable rates. Comfortable beds. Fantastic showers. Free parking. The bad: The hotel layout is more like a motel, so be prepared for people walking up and down outside your window. Our TV didn't work. It simply wouldn't switch on. The fridge is so noisy we had to unplug it. Air conditioning is good, but noisy. And now for the most frustrating part... The Internet access. This may not be a big problem for many, but as we both had work to do while traveling, it was a huge issue for us. There is free wifi, but it is TERRIBLE. You can browse very slowly, but if you have to upload or download even the tiniest document, it struggles to a halt. It took me four hours to upload a 55kb document, no exaggeration. Free wifi is not an excuse for poor wifi. They have a computer in the reception area for guest use, but it's using the same crappy Internet connection. It took us over 45 minutes to book and print 2 tickets for universal studios because the connection was so bad. Even more frustrating... If you go to the bar or lobby of the hotel next door, the Hollywood Heights, you get super fast free wifi. We ended up in there most evenings just so we could get our work emails answered. If I had no need for Internet, I would mark this hotel 4 outta 5. The frustrations we experienced though, would make me give it 2 and a half outta 5.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: HonestReviewerAus
Reviews.Content: My partner and I checked in at the last minute after seeing the awful hostel we had booked. I highly recommend this hotel. Check in was fast and friendly, we were upgraded to a spacious room with King bed and pool view. It was immaculate. The pool is nice, although a little on the small side, and the location is great. Close to all the attractions on Hollywood Boulevard and one stop on the metro to Universal studios. If you are someone who wants a nice place for a decent price in Hollywood stay here!

Reviews.Title: “great location for affordable price”
Reviews.Author: JUXPrague
Reviews.Content: Spent couple of nights there in Feb 09. The hotel has very large rooms (for european standards), a pool, free parking. The main thing is its location, within 5-10 mins walking distance you get to Kodak Theatre, walk of fame etc. If you have a car (and you must have in LA), it is a very good place to start your trips from - all the studios (Universal, WB) are very near, as well the Mullholand Drive entry Overall, clean, nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best Western Hollywood Plaza Inn- May 17-19,2010”
Reviews.Author: bengch
Reviews.Content: My parents and Myself came to LA for a few days visit before going to Cancun, Mexico for a Medical Convention for World Organization of Family Doctors. I've found the place thru internet search and after going through favorable reviews I booked it. It actually live up to my expectations, the room we stayed was cozy, clean and its near the pool, the front desk satff was very friendly and accomodating and was the one who suggested to try out the LA city tours since he found out its our first time in LA and his suggestion was fantastic! we had a blast and made our few days stay in LA worthwhile. The place also has an in-house resto - SPICE which is very convenient especially for filling up your stomach in the morning. Another plus was the free internet, a big add-on! And the location is just a few minutes walk to Hollywood boulevard,the Hollywood Walk of Fame, Kodak Theater, Grauman's Chinese Theater, Madame Tussaud's, Hollywood Wax Museum, Ripley's Beieve It or Not, Souvenir shops, restaurants, convenient stores and also the Hollywood Bowl on the other end of the street is just nearby and you can actually get a glimpse of the Hollywood Sign when you're near Franklin Avenue going to the hotel. We will definitely check this place out again when we go to LA and actually recommended it to my friends who have plans going to LA.

Reviews.Title: “ITS WAS AN AWESOME STAY!!!”
Reviews.Author: jasonsweet2010
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the best western and it was by far one of my best places to stay. The room were nice and service was amazing. The front desk was on top of there game (Heather & Brenda) I would recommend this location and location to all my friends. I LOVE THE SHOWER...Its was awesome. Thanks for a great time and stay....

Reviews.Title: “We received excellent customer service, stayed in clean and ecnomical rooms.”
Reviews.Author: IIllinoscinderella
Reviews.Content: Resturant on site, with international cusine, but we did not get to sample food due to sechedule issues. Front desk staff and Housekeeping services were excellent and actually above and beyond in assisting us with a non hotel related problem. Excellent location in Hollywood. We walked roughly 2 long blocks to the Hollywood walk of Fame, Metro, and large open air food court and shopping center. I would love to stay there again. Clean and Safe location.

Reviews.Title: “A Unexpected Visitor at 10:30pm knocking on my door was a horror!!!”
Reviews.Author: DJNYC212
Reviews.Content: Having stayed this hotel for 2 nights in the past and there was no problem. I rebooked the room that was located on the 2nd floor and in the corner room. Early evening, the male hotel staff was moving the cart to move towels etc., and I saw him face to face as he walked by in front of my room. Suprise happened later that night. It was about 10:30pm, the same Hispanic male cleaner knocking on my door to say hello. As a single female traveller staying in a room in this hotel, I felt like I was harrassed. He told me behind the door that if I want to drink a coffee. I opened the curtain just a bit to see through the window what's in his hands was a same plastic bag of coffee in the hotel room. IS THIS A JOKE? I packed my stuff and got out ASAP, slept over at sauna in Korea town. Not recommended for women staying on their own.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: luvsmacca65
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 4 night stay at the Best Western Hollywood Plaza hotel. This hotel is very centrally located for sightseeing in Hollywood, if that is the purpose of your stay. I went to 2 concerts at the Hollywood Bowl which is literally a 5 minute walk from the hotel. I also walked to Hollywood Blvd and all of it's so-called attractions (about a 10 minute walk). The rooms are basic Best Western but very clean and well maintained. Each has a microwave and a small fridge which is great since there is no free breakfast here, There is a small restaurant onsite which is open between 7am-12 noon and again from 5-9pm. I had one breakfast and one dinner here and have nothing to complain about,. Decent food and reasonable prices. Shuttle from Burbank airport is $20 one way. LAX is a bit more but still reasonable if you don't rent a car. And if you do rent a car, this hotel has free parking which is very rare in this area! The staff here is friendly and helpful. Always a pleasant greeting and an offer to help in anything you need from directions to shuttles to suggestions on places to see. All in all I was well pleased with my stay and can recommend the hotel for a centrally located, clean and safe place to stay in Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “Best value in the immediate area.”
Reviews.Author: California9
Reviews.Content: Walking distance from Hollywood Bowl and Kodak Theater. The rooms are smallish but well kept up. Bathrooms more than adequate and showers outstanding. Front desk busy but very courteous, caring, and efficient. Rates are best value in the immediate area and there are no Gotchas. Even parking is included.

Reviews.Title: “Very loud! Do not stay if you want to sleep.”
Reviews.Author: njjoe92
Reviews.Content: The rooms open to the outside and each of the 3 nights we stayed here we were kept awake at all hours of the night by loud people shouting and taxis honking or traffic noise. The location is very convenient to Hollywood attractions, great shower and we had a hair dryer replaced very promptly, but it was certainly not worth the loss of sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Central & Good value Motel”
Reviews.Author: SeaRonin
Reviews.Content: This is a back up to all the good reviews my fallow travellers said : If you are in LA and you plan on travelling all day and you need a place to lay your head in the end of it, this is your place. The location enables you to walk to Hollywood Blv and see the sites or if you have a car and you wish to get to the other area's of LA the 101 Freeway is 500 m. away and you can get in and out of Hollywood easily. (Universal City is only 2 exits from this location) The rooms have all the basics - coffee machine, microwave, fridge and a TV. they are big enough for 4 people and the shower is great. if anyone worries about the noise - we were stay in t he 1st room next to the street and still the noise was min. Additional pluses: free parking & smoking/non smoking separation, free internet connection (and if you don't have a laptop with you you have in the lobby a computer for a quick use) and a small restaurant in case you want a quick breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and good value for central Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: NeilHa
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights during late Sept '09, having stayed here 12 months previous, and knew how great a central location this was for visiting Walk of Fame (2 blocks away), Sunset Strip (10 min drive), Universal Studios (10 min drive) and Santa Monica/Venice Beaches (20 min drive). Rooms are clean, well-appointed and despite being near to the main highway (N Highland Ave), we weren't bothered at all by road noise. Parking is free for guests, which is a saving of $20+/day compared to most hotels nearby. Paid approx £74/night thru' Hotels.com but it is worth shopping around as originally we had booked direct with BW which would have cost us £90+/night. On-site restaurant offers breakfast, lunch and dinner menu but there is a Starbucks nearby, for breakfast, and we used the California Pizza Kitchen restaurant just 2 blocks away (near Walk of Fame) for other meals. Used the bar at the Hollywood Heights Hotel next door as this hotel doesn't have one. Great views of the iconic "Hollywood" sign from the kirbside of the hotel. Free internet access (PC & printer) available in Reception, which we used a lot.

Reviews.Title: “A well placed friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: Choirman09
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well placed for those not wishing to drive themselves around the LA area. A few minutes walk down the hill takes you to the central point of the Hollywood experience. You can pick up trips easily - or be picked up from the hotel. For the more adventurous tourist you can also pick up the metro from Hollywood Boulevard. If you want to, the Hollywood Bowl is in walking distance. The rooms are tidy and well kept. We had a slight problem when my car was his by another guests car, and the lobby staff were more than willing to help a british tourist find their way around the phone sysyem. The restaurant provides good food at a reasonable price with good service.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: jumiko
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for 4 nights and we had no problems.The room was clean and everything worked.Just 2 blocks from hollywood boulevard and the center of hollywood,the location of the hotel is nice and also the free parking.We would stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a Hollywood Bowl concert!”
Reviews.Author: Inyogirl
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here Saturday night for a John Williams concert at the Hollywood Bowl. I chose this hotel because it's a ten minute walk to the Bowl . Had a room on the second floor (it's three stories) in the middle, so no problem with street noise. Double-bedded room was comfortable, with a large screen TV. Tub and toilet are together, and then there's a vanity area with sink, microwave and small refrigerator. Simple amenities -- lotion, shampoo, two kinds of soap bars. Lots of towels. Closet space very adequate. Coffee maker -- always appreciated! Didn't try the restaurant, so can't speak to that. Apparently they have room service, but it's not 24 hour. Quick check-in and check-out. Computer in the lobby, so if you didn't bring your laptop, you're covered. Free parking, a big plus. Spaces are tight, especially if somebody drives a SUV and parks it in the "compact" spot -- I almost backed into an SUV, and I drive a Saturn. But it may have been the last spot left, so what can you say. Close to Hollywood Boulevard, Hollywood & Highland, the Chinese Theatre, all the places people do seem to want to visit (I am constantly amazed every time I go to Hollywood that there are so many people walking up and down the boulevard). There's a Subway across the street, for that quick getaway sandwich. For more substantial groceries, exit the hotel, turn right, drive past Hollywood Boulevard and hang a right onto Sunset -- there's a great Ralph's about six blocks down on the right. Reasonable rate -- for Hollywood, at any rate. All in all, I'd recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet and reasonable”
Reviews.Author: Moreea1
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here with my children (for the second time). The location of the hotel is central to everything in LA including the freeway entrance across the street. If you want to get a bite to eat you can walk a block down and find tons of places to eat. The rate was reasonable, safe location, free parking (other hotels charge $25-$30), quiet at night no one screaming or yelling, clean, no bed bugs (no sure what that bug photo was all about), WIFI was good except there is no mobile phone reception in the room. I would recommend anyone to stay here if you are looking for a clean, quiet place for your family. The other hotels across the street charge double, why pay more!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great Motel”
Reviews.Author: Yecart77
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed there for three nights and found the room to be very clean and comfortable - no ants as some people have previously mentioned. The location is central to all that we wanted to do in LA and was very reasonably priced. We picked up a hire car on the night before we were leaving and the free parking spot per room is handy as alot of other hotels charge for parking. The Wifi in the rooms did not have a very strong signal, you could get by with normal web browsing but no good for people who use VPN.

Reviews.Title: “more than acceptable”
Reviews.Author: mikester92117
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel several times because I visit a client in the area. And since I travel by Amtrak / Metro, I'm almost always without a car, so location is the dominating factor here. I found this hotel to be acceptable or better than acceptable. The little cafe is decent for breakfast, and very fast. But having stayed there several times in the last two years, I decided on my last trip to try the Comfort Suites that is directly across the street. Next stay will be back at this hotel as the CS was a nightmare in multiple ways. It seems to be relatively quiet, the rooms are usually clean but not fancy. But it's not in disrepair. So it works for me, but it ain't the Renaissance down the street, but it's also way cheaper. It's close to Hollywood & Highland which is an active area and worth checking out. It's also close to the Hollywood Bowl.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: xaak
Reviews.Content: We (2ad, 2 ch) had here a two nights stay during our california trip. The hotel was adequate and for the price very good. What I disliked is the U-style of motels, where the window of the room is next to the door and the corridor. We experienced some problems with parking but the staff helped us to find a parking spot. Short but not so pleasant (no shops, crossing a big avenue) walk to Sunset boulevard. WiFi is working also in windows mobile 6 (omnia). The internet-PC in reception has also a printer proved very useful for printing the Lakers tickets which I forgot home.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in L.A.”
Reviews.Author: KenSmith
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 5 nights over Easter and it lived up to its good reputation. It was good value for money and very clean. The staff were very friendly and helpful. There is free wifi and a guest desktop available in reception. The coffee machine, fridge and microwave came in handy and the shower was great. The hotel is in a good position withing walking distance of the Hollywood Bowl, Kodak Theatre and 'Walk of Fame' in Hollywood Blvd. Hollywood Highland Metro Station is close and by using it you can reach most places in L.A. from downtown to Long Beach (Queen Mary) for $1.25 (or a day card for $5). Traffic is really bad in L.A. so don't bother to hire a car until you are moving on - parking free for one car. It was easy to reach the hotel using public transport from Los Angeles International Airport (LAX). Take the Blue Fly Away bus going to Union Station ($6 - pay at kiost when you arrive at Union Station) then take the Red Metro Line (ticket from machine as you go to the Red line for $1.25) to Hollywood Highland. Turn left out of station, first left and a 10 minute walk!

Reviews.Title: “major ant problem in bathrooms”
Reviews.Author: chloe87
Reviews.Content: Room was a good value otherwise. Seemed like a clean decent room. Would have returned prior to finding ants. They appeared in the bathroom on the third night of a 3-night stay. When I called front desk to say that there were a lot of ants in the bathroom, they sent someone up with bug spray. I told them we couldn't stay in that room after spraying, so they did put us in a nicer, bigger room and were very accomodating. However, a short time later, we discovered the same ant problem in that bathroom. We called, but as it was our last night and it was late, we decided to stick it out, although we did report it. The hotel was responsive and even refunded us one night''s stay. I would recommend asking several direct questions about how the ant problem was resolved. In my opinion, ongoing extermination service to take care of this problem and prevent the problem in the future, is the only way I would feel OK about staying here again. I know ants can come in to any living area, often in search of water, even if it's clean. But speaking from personal experience, I also know that a continuous pest service may be necessary.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and good price”
Reviews.Author: frix26
Reviews.Content: This is a motel style hotel with rooms around a courtyard. It is cheap to stay here and the location is excellent. It is only a few mins walk from the walk of fame. The parking is free which is very handy and the staff are very helpful. The rooms themselves are ok but fairly average. I would recommend if you want a good deal in a good location

Reviews.Title: “Good value, pleased with stay, no real complaints”
Reviews.Author: sc120
Reviews.Content: I recently came back from LA and stayed at this hotel. The location can't be beat, only a short walk from Hollywood Blvd, near the Kodak and Chinese theaters. Overall, I visited different parts of LA and felt it was in a central location to the things I wanted to do. The hotel is located on a busy street, which made it a little difficult to get out in the direction you want to go, but was only a mild inconvenience. The rooms have air conditioning, microwave/fridge, coffee pot, flat screen TV, hair dryer, iron, nice comfortable bedding. The hotel was very clean. They had a small pool, though I didn't use it. Internet access was free. They also had one computer/printer for free in lobby, Parking was free for 1 car and I did not have trouble finding a spot each night. Front desk service was friendly and helpful. They have a little cafe, Spice. I only ate their once for breakfast and wasn't overly impressed, but service was fine, and it would be good for a quick bite. Starbucks, Subway and a small grocery store where you can pick up drinks/snacks are located about a block away as well.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel to explore Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: travel_chiq
Reviews.Content: Best aspect of this hotel is location, just a hop from Hollywood & Highland. Very close to Hollywood Blvd and the Hollywood Bowl. I traveled with a friend. Our DOUBLE ROOM was clean and spacious for 2 people. It had a mini fridge, microwave, ironing board with iron, and the usual coffee selections. Decor is nice, updated and had a new flat screen TV. We were told wireless internet access was free, but we didnt bring our laptops. There is a computer with printing in the lobby. There is not much parking, but we were lucky to find a space when we came back at night. There is an in hotel coffee shop, but we did not use it. Opted to eat at the nearby Hollywood & Highland Center. Hollywood & Highland Center is fun to just hang out. Lots of places to eat and shop. And well within walking distance. Other nearby attractions include the Kodak Theatre, Grauman's Chinese Theatre, Sunset Blvd. Overall, it was a good place to stay for the $$ considering that it was just a home base for us to use while enjoying LA.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: md7696
Reviews.Content: We (me & 3 kids) joined my husband who was on business, close to the downtown sights although a dangerous walk. Close to the highway exit. Nice pool and hot tub which we used in February. Motel like entrance to the rooms but very clean and accomodating and the restaurant was good. They were not very flexible with a late check out but everything else was great considering the cheap price of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Worth Every Penny”
Reviews.Author: OneAfter909
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay here at the best western hollywood plaza so i really didnt know what to expect. We got there about 3-4 hours before normal check in time and they gave us a generous early check in. The room was exceptional and exceeded my expectations of a motel room. The bed was nice, neat and clean (no bed bugs of any sort). There was a coffee maker, microwave and mini fridge. The bathroom was spacious and had a giant mirror on the wall. Everything was spot clean. To be honest i was very hesitant when booking this room because cleanliness was my absolute top concern. And this motel satisfied every concern of mine. The location cant be beat either, its just a few steps away from hollywood and highland and a few miles away from universal studios so its right in the heard of hollywood. I would DEFINITELY stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location . . .”
Reviews.Author: red1962
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd trip to Hollywood. The first time we stayed at the Best Western Hollywood Hills so we thought we would try this hotel this time because it is within walking distance of Hollywood Blvd & Highland (happening spot). The staff at the Best Western Hollywood Plaza is very nice. The room is way nicer at the Hollywood Hills but the location of the Best Western Hollywood Plaza can't be beat. If you are spending a lot of time in your room, don't stay here. The room is very very 'motel' but if you are just sleeping there, the proximity to the highway and walking distance to all the fun stuff to do can't be beat. The parking was really easy and there was lots of it. It is difficult to get out of the hotel to the main street during peak hours because it is on a main street. The pool is at the back of the hotel and works fine. There is a hot tub there too. You can also read my 2007 review of the Best Western Hollywood Hills. Better Room = Best Western Hollywood Hills Better Location = Best Western Hollywood Plaza

Reviews.Title: “Basic Room with Motel Feel - Close to Hollywood Sites”
Reviews.Author: colmmoo
Reviews.Content: The hotel is walking distance (a couple of blocks away) to the most popular Hollywood sites - the Walk of Fame and Mann's Chinese Theater. One can also walk to Melrose Avenue and Sunset also. It's a safe area and you see other people walking outside. The hotel is a 10-minute drive to Universal Studios too. Price includes free wifi and free parking (spaces are small so if you have a big car, it'll be a tough squeeze). Reception was very nice - felt like a real hotel but once you get to the rooms, it starts to look more like a motel because it's open air so your door opens to the outside. It's not a bad thing - looks worst if you arrive at night as the corridors are lit with fluorescent lighting. The room is in good shape - not rundown. Our only complaint was that there were small ants in the bathroom - on the sink counter and a few on the floor. They seemed to coming from behind the bathroom mirror. Other than that, the rest of the room was fine. Breakfast is not included but there is a tiny restaurant connected to the hotel that serves breakfast, lunch and dinner. There is a Starbucks a short drive away in a mini strip mall. There is a pool but it's adjacent to the parking garage.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Wilson080
Reviews.Content: Really pleased with location - just minutes from Hollywood Boulevard & Hollywood Bowl. We asked for a quiet upstairs room which we got. I always find Best Westerns to be good value with great service. We has a great breakfast in the little cafe attached to the motel.

Reviews.Title: “The Hollywood experience”
Reviews.Author: AZJOHN1
Reviews.Content: Everything about the hotel...checkin, cleanliness, etc...was nice. The lobby was crowded, especially if someone is checking in with bags. I think I am getting too old for Hollywood anymore. This hotel is within walking distance of the Hollywood Blvd. attractions, and it's on a main street. So there is traffic (cars and pedestrians)and congestion 24 hours a day. On the night I stayed, there was an event just up the street at Hollywood Bowl, and it was especially congested. This is an open-air hotel, and there is a wall of smoked glass that faces the street and keeps most of the street noise out of the hotel. So, if you're looking for a clean place to stay while doing tourist things in Hollywood, this is a reliable hotel. You can park here and not deal with the hassles of driving and parking while you do your sightseeing on foot. If you're looking for calm and a spacious place to relax, you'd be better off booking a hotel in Burbank and driving into Hollywood for your sightseeing days.

Reviews.Title: “Nice value for the location”
Reviews.Author: rnbnut
Reviews.Content: I don't know, I'm not a native of L.A., haven't stayed in many hotels there, but we loved the B.W. Hollywood Plaza. Well appointed room, and according to my research was value price for the location. What more do you need? Walking distance to downtown Hollywood. We paid $150 through the hotel website. Noise? Never heard a peep. I wonder if some people just don't sleep well, blame it on the hotel. We live in a super quiet secluded rural home, neither of us had any problems here. And we go to sleep by 11:00. Tip for jazz fans: try the Baked Potato nightclub. A couple of miles north. Very cool, great musicians. Intimate.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: fashion_victim409
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel, I thought it was really up to standard. The pool was lovely, especially since we had the lovely weather for it! It goes as deep as 8ft which was cool. The jacuzzi was nice too! Room was lovely, bathroom very snazzy. The TV was a flat screen with around 60 odd channels....it was near luxury. There was a fridge, microwave and a coffee maker in the room as well, but after buying milk for cereal and putting it in the fridge, it froze the next morning!? Maybe they need to adjust their temperatures! There was air conditioning in the room, but it was right beside the bed, which blocked alot of air coming out...bit of a silly place to put it, but it wasn't too bad. The location was great, it's only down the road from the Highland Centre and the Hollywood Walk of Fame. All in all, it was a great hotel and I'd definitely consider going back. I really liked how the rooms were all under porches outside...however, people going to their rooms late at night like to talk quite loudly...which reverberates around the whole floor >:(

Reviews.Title: “I'm glad I didn't listen to the bad reviews”
Reviews.Author: DYLANNN
Reviews.Content: After reading about bed bugs and roaches, I was apprehensive about staying here, but booked my room nonetheless as it is, in fact, very close to EVERYTHING. It was close to the freeway entrance, as well. GREAT LOCATION! The front desk kept it very simple and easy for both check-in and check-out, which was a relief considering how tired we were. The room was clean and the beds were sufficiently comfortable - NO BUGS! The only thing that they could improve upon is their shower... It was all hard water and felt kind of slimy. Other than that, great stay at the Best Western Holywood Plaza!

Reviews.Title: “Second stay was a bad experience”
Reviews.Author: PlanoGuys
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to this Best Western location. We stayed here in 2005 and had a pleasant stay. It is very convenient to the Hollywood Blvd. and Highland complex. Nearby Hollywood attractions include the Hollywood Walk of Fame, Graumann's Theatre, the Kodak Theatre. Parking can be a challenge especially during weekends but we always managed to find a spot. This was our second stay at this hotel, but we won't be staying there again. This visit started off on a bad note when the front desk tried to charge us about $50 more per day claiming that the rate that we had received on our confirmed reservation through "bestwestern.com" was just an estimate. After complaining, the clerk agreed to talk to the manager and eventually called to tell us that we would receive the rate that I had agreed to pay on my reservation. Beware of this since others have complained on TripAdvisor about "fluctuating" prices at this particular hotel. The rooms have outdoor entrances connected by walkways. The people next to us stood outside their room smoking and talking at all hours of the day since they were in a non-smoking room. We could hear them talking while we were inside our room. Our sleep was interrupted repeately on two of the three nights that we stayed at this hotel. The second night was worse with yelling and the sounds of things being broken coming from a room on the other side of the walkway and one floor below us. We called the front desk to ask that they send security to stop the noise but it continued for several hours. The next day we complained to the front desk that nothing had been done about the noise after we called. They apologized and acknowledged that many other people had also complained. Later that day the manager left us a voice mail informing us that she had given us one of the three nights free. The least expensive of the three nights was deducted instead of one of the two more expensive nights with actual noise issues. This hotel had other noise problems also. We could hear cars coming and going from the parking area since the rooms are located directly above it. Some of those cars had the need to honk in the middle of the night for some unknown reason. The sound of trucks driving on Highland could also be heard in the rooms. If location is all that is important for you, this is a great hotel. If you care about quiet and uninterrupted sleep and friendly service, this might not be the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Free parking and a clean bed was all we needed (and got)”
Reviews.Author: FriesAndFoieGras
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of reading (especially the TripAdvisor website!) to find a suitable place to stay for our visit to Universal Studios. Eventually chose this for the location so we could squeeze in a bit of Hollywood in the evenings as well. Stayed in a 1King bedroom ($109 fr BW website). Once the suitcases were on the floor, there was little space for the two of us to maneuver. Another room where four of our traveling companions slept had 2 Doubles ($119) and that was more spacious. Other reviewers said this BW was really near Hollywood Boulevard and so we took a (non-scenic) walk, a good ten minutes away and it seems longer if you’re tired. Manager has maps of the area that are useful and you can easily get a copy upon request. What was slightly worrying was the fact that other people on lower floors could peer into our room through the heater vents in the wall. So do take note if you’re concerned about privacy. Overall a basic motel that I chose due to the location, and there was not much else going for it. I didn't even get the ants that were promised!

Reviews.Title: “If you love ants, this place is for you!”
Reviews.Author: ttillman
Reviews.Content: Though the staff are friendly and the location close to everything, this property has a serious problem with ants. I've stayed here a few times on business and the ant situation is nuts! One night I bought a bottle of Coke from the vending machine. I left the empty bottle on the nightstand (closed) and the next morning it was covered in hundreds of ants. I've seen ants in the rooms before, but not like this. There are ants everywhere. You know how homes in horror films are built on ancient burial grounds? This motel must've been built on an ancient burial ground for ants.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: cerise64
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great for so many reasons! Firstly, the location was perfect. It is located in West Hollywood which is cleaner and quieter than Hollywood however it was only a 5min walk to get to Hollywood blvd, graumanns chinese theatre, kodak theatre, a nice outdoor shopping mall, and more shopping on the street, not to mention a view of the Hollywood sign. Sunset was only another block past Hwood blvd. One stop on the nearby metro will take you to Universal Studios and, if you're interested in renting a car for your stay, you can obtain one just down the street at the Renaissance Hotel. Oh, and this hotel offers free parking. Secondly, the staff were extremely friendly, accommodating and helpful. The rooms are secure, clean but a bit small; I wouldn't want to stay there with more than one other person or perhaps 2 very tiny people. The onsite restaurant was good and affordable. Last, but certainly not least, it was VERY affordable! Booking online on the www.bestwestern.com site offered great savings for a perfect location and a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Low rating in cleanliness”
Reviews.Author: jiseguerreros
Reviews.Content: This Best Western is ok for the money we paid. I actually booked it online through my Costco club membership travel program with their discounted rate. We stayed for Thanksgiving weekend and it was NOT as crowded as I expected. It was my husband and I with our two children ages 11 and 2. Location was perfect, close to the famous Hollywood and Sunset Boulevards...if going with a large crowd, you can easily walk to these locations from hotel, but since we had our kids, we didn't take a chance since it's not a safe area to walk at night. It's perfect location if you're going to visit Universal Studios....only 5minutes away. Hotel was nice and clean when we checked in, but the two night s after that, the cleaning staff forgot to vacuum the carpet and clean the bathroom floor. When I called the front desk the first night to ask for extra towels, it took over a 1/2 hr to bring them to us, so I didn't even want to bother calling to have them vacuum at night time. We had a mini fridge and microwave along with coffee maker, which were all nice to have since the hotel does NOT provide any complimentary breakfast. They do have a restaurant onsite, but beware....prices are very HIGH. Their parking lot is on the first floor, under the rooms and the spaces are VERY tight, so if you're driving a big SUV, you will have a hard time getting in/out of your vehicle.I will say, though, that as I checked out and complained about the floor not being cleaned during our stay, they offered me an additional discount off my total rate and it was much appreciated. This shows that they have good customer service and want my business. Overall it was nice, I would go back again since Rica was nice enough to offer me that complimentary discount for my inconvenience.

Reviews.Title: “It was just really clean”
Reviews.Author: princessjenCalgary
Reviews.Content: This hotel was so clean! When I am looking for a hotel the cleanliness factor is a major deciding factor. Finding a good hotel at a good rate is quite a difficult task, but this hotel was a major success. In addition to the hotel being clean, the location was amazing for tourists and the staff was super friendley. It was a really good experience. The hotel is a bit dated, however if you are looking for a clean budget hotel, this is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Warning!! Man Found In Room At 3 a.m.”
Reviews.Author: guanointoronto
Reviews.Content: The room was what you would come to expect from a Best Western (reasonably priced, clean, and no frills) however, upon our return from a night out, a maintenace man was in our room at 3a.m. claiming to be investigating a broken toilet yet held no tools and was caught standing between the beds (nowhere near the bathroom). We called front desk to clarify and confirm if there had been any calls placed that evening for a broken toilet and they informed me that no calls had been placed from any suite in the hotel. Furthermore, an access card was found haphazardly placed among one of our suitcases which could possibly mean that it was dropped while he was snooping. As three young females, we value safety and security while travelling. However, this incident left us feeling violated and front desk did little or nothing to reassure us of our safety and the security of our possessions. If you do decide to stay here, I'd keep a close eye on your luggage and beware (as you always should).

Reviews.Title: “Worth the price”
Reviews.Author: 2RPS
Reviews.Content: I stayed here from August 20 to the 23rd and felt that it was worth the price. I recommend the hotel. It's more like a family-run business. The staff was most helpful and friendly. The 800 number isn't the best way to get personal service or even to be sure that the hotel knows what's happening.
